intro: Karekandelia celebica, commonly known as the Celebes karekandelia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Indonesian island of Sulawesi. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a glossy surface. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
